definitions.text: corrupt morally or by intemperance or sensuality
examples: debauch the young people with wine and women
Socrates was accused of corrupting young men
Do school counselors subvert young children?

definitions.text: practice sophistry; change the meaning of or be vague about in order to mislead or deceive
change the inherent purpose or function of something
examples: The director of the factory misused the funds intended for the health care of his workers

definitions.text: (used of sexual behavior) showing or appealing to bizarre or deviant tastes
having an intended meaning altered or misrepresented
examples: many of the facts seemed twisted out of any semblance to reality
a perverted translation of the poem

definitions.text: deviating from what is considered moral or right or proper or good
examples: the reprobate conduct of a gambling aristocrat
